result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek J Gustason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to the Rice Lake Probation Office by 3:00 PM on Monday, December 1, 2014.

miscConds.notes:
$220.00 buy money is to be paid joint and several with Alicia R in 14CF87 and Heather M in 14CF86.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia unless prescribed by a physician directly to him.
Must have no contact with Alicia R except by telephone, e-mail or text messaging regarding their child.
Must have no contact with Heather M.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

THIS COVERS 14CF39,14CF86,14CF87,and 14CF88 
14CF39 & 14CF86 Defendant Heather C Munson in court with Attorney John G Hinde.  Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF87 Defendant Alicia Ann Remley in court with attorney Richard L Yonko. Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF88 Defendant Derek J Gustafson in court with Attorney Kate Murtaugh. Defendant in custody.  Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:37 Jason Hagen, Detective with the Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn, and direct by State.
10:42 cross by Attorney Murtaugh. 10:43 cross by Attorney Hinde. 10:48 cross by Attorney Yonko. 10:52 redirect by State. 10:53 recross by Attorney Hinde.  10:54 Court questions. 10:55 recross by Attorney Murtaugh.  10:57 recross by Attorney Hinde.  10:57 Testimony Closed. 

Attorney Hinde moves to dismiss. Argument by State. Argument by Attorney Murtaugh and move to dismiss. Argument by Attorney Yonko and moves to dismiss. Attorney Hinde willing to submit brief's. State does not wish to brief.
